STStackato On the Road with PaaS

Show environment and setup, including versions of all apps

TOP LEVEL SCRIPTS:

  1. Setup/Prerequisites
  2. simple jsp -> tomcat -> stackato
  3. spring -> tomcat -> stackato 3a. cover this: Configure -> Enable as CloudFoundry Standalone App (what’s it do?)
  4. What about the “other” IDEs: NB and IDEA options: load project manually deploy with stackato client IDEA V12 (http://blogs.jetbrains.com/idea/2012/06/intellij-idea-12-leda-preview-is-out/)

TITLE: STS and Stackato Manage the Cloud With Eclipse

What is this?

Why is this important?

Where can you learn more?

SETUP: VirtualBox, MicroCloud, STS, CF plugin

  1. download VirtualBox
  2. download microcloud
  3. import vm
  4. configure bridged network
  5. boot
  6. web console, create account, deploy some app (env?)
  7. install STS
  8. tomcat
  9. install/configure eclipse cloud foundry plugin

CAST1: create simple web app

SLIDE: First web app Slide: Prerequisites (see SETUP)

Script 1: (MAKE THIS SIMPLYJSP INSTEAD) Launch STS Dashboard File -> New -> “Static Web Project” Image 1 make sure select “Dynamic Web Module Version” 2.5 Click “finish” (or take defaults in next two screens) STS will offer to open JavaEE Perspective: accept

Right-click project, select New JSP: index.jsp Default template

Add simple HTML to JSP:

Greetings

Then “Run As” -> “Run on Server” Choose Tomcat

Ensure new “SimpleJSP” is listed in “Configured” column

Voila! App is launched within tomcat container

Show lifecycle: edit index.jsp, restart server (is there a better way?)

Slide: basis of all web apps, serlets, etc.

Script 2: Launch STS Dashboard File -> New -> “Static Web Project” – call it Springtime Image 1 make sure select “Dynamic Web Module Version” 2.5 Click “finish” (or take defaults in next two screens) STS will offer to open JavaEE Perspective: accept

Right-click project, select New JSP: index.jsp Default template

Add simple HTML to JSP:

Greetings

Then “Run As” -> “Run on Server” Choose Tomcat

Ensure new “SimpleJSP” is listed in “Configured” column

Voila! App is launched within tomcat container

Show lifecycle: edit index.jsp, restart server (is there a better way?)

Script 5: Camel: cover templates: http://janstey.blogspot.com/2008/08/eclipse-templates-for-apache-camel.html cover cookbook and examples and tutorials http://camel.apache.org/cookbook.html http://camel.apache.org/examples.html http://camel.apache.org/tutorials.html

Specifically: URI -> componenets/processors -> mongodb

Steps:

  1. New Project -> Maven Project
  2. Add Archetype catelog: http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/archetype-catalog.xml 3.
